graphOrientation.C: Specifies the orientation of one dimensional graphs

invertGraph.C: Flag to invert horizontal one dimensional graphs to plot from right to left

view.C: Specify the starting view of the data

isR.C: Flag to indicate is running from the R library. For developers only

isCxplot.C: Flag to indicate is using cxplot

isReproducibleResearch.C: Flag to indicate to track user modifications for Reproducible Research. For developers only

reproduceTime.C: Time to wait in milliseconds to reproduce user modifications through the UI

overplotPixels.C: Number of pixels to stack for overplotting. The higher the number the less overplotting. Useful for datasets with large number of variables

editable.C: Editable in JS Fiddle and CodePen

theme.C: Themes for the plot. This parameter will overwrite colors, background, axes, etc

fullTextMeasureCheck.C: Full thorough check of variable and sample names when more than the specified number. This is useful for large data sets as canvas has not an efficent maner to measure text

metaData.C: Meta data for files read from a url

plotBackgroundBorderColor.C: Color for the border in plot background

plotBackgroundBorderSize.C: Size for the border line in plot background

plotBackgroundBorderLineType.C: Type of line for the border in plot background

panelBackgroundBorderColor.C: Color for the border in panel background

panelBackgroundBorderSize.C: Size for the border line in panel background

panelBackgroundBorderLineType.C: Type of line for the border in panel background

backgroundType.C: Specifies the style for the background of the canvas. The canvas background is composed of a frame with a panel where the data is plotted. Either of these elements the may be a solid or gradient color or an image of your choosing. The colorScheme property will be used If gradient is specified

backgroundImage.C: Specifies the url for the background image when the background type is of the type image or panelImage

backgroundImageSrc.C: Specifies the source for the background image when the background type is of the type image or panelImage

cacheBase64.C: Cache image in meta data as Base64

printType.C: Type of printing when the camera icon in the UI is pressed. Download is to download the image while window is to save the image in a new browser window

printMagnification.C: Print Magnification to produce High Definition images. Courtesy of Baohong Zhang

saveFilename.C: Filename to use when downloading the canvas as an image or as json. If not specified. the filename will be based on the target id of the canvas. cX- + canvas.targetId + extension

transparency.C: Percentage of transparency applied to all elements in the visualizations

transparencyHidden.C: Percentage of transparency applied to elements that are hidden

highlightGreyOut.C: Flag to add grey out when highlighting with mouse over

highlightGreyOutTransparency.C: Fraction of transparency for grey out when highlighting with mouse over

ggplot.C: Initial ggplot configuration passed to cxplot

effect.C: Effect used to show widgets Magic - Ver 1.3.0 - https://minimamente.com

gradient.C: Flag used to apply gradients to all objects in the graphs

gradientOrientation.C: Specifies the orientation of the gradient if the gradient type is of the type linear

gradientRatio.C: Specifies the ratio used to generate linear gradients

adjustAspectRatio.C: Flag to automatically adjust the size of the bars or points in the one dimensional plots to fit in the provided canvas width and height. If the flag is set to false the width and height of the canvas will be sized according to the number of bars or points in the data set

percentAspectRatioPlotArea.C: Specifies the minimum percentage for the plotting area

fixedAspectRatio.C: Keep fixed aspect ratio expressed as y / x. A zero value is used to ignore otherwise the x and y axes are set accordingly

variableSpace.C: Pixels between the variables in the one dimensional plots

widthFactor.C: Factor to adjust the width of the bars in the one dimensional and the three dimensional plots. The greater the number, the wider the bars

dataPointSize.C: Approximate size for the data points in scatter plots, dotplots and boxplots. The size will be adjusted according to the dimensions of the graph

dataPointSizeScaleFactor.C: Factor used to adjust the size of the dataPointSize

setPlotX.C: Force the x dimension for the data plot in one dimensional graphs

setPlotY.C: Force the y dimension for the data plot in one dimensional graphs

setPlotLeft.C: Force the left dimension for the data plot in one dimensional graphs

setPlotTop.C: Force the top dimension for the data plot in one dimensional graphs

foreground.C: Color for the Specifies the foreground color for text or lines not covered in a more specific configuration property

background.C: Color for the Specifies the background color for the canvas

margin.C: Relative length in pixels for the distance between various objects in the graphs. This value is adjusted acording to the graph dimensions if the adjustAspectRatio parameter is set to true

marginLeft.C: Specifies the length in pixels for the left margin in the canvas

marginTop.C: Specifies the length in pixels for the top margin in the canvas

marginBottom.C: Specifies the length in pixels for the bottom margin in the canvas

marginRight.C: Specifies the length in pixels for the right margin in the canvas

showShadow.C: Flag to show/hide the shadows in all graph objects in the canvas. It will be forced to false if the browser is IE

showTextShadow.C: Flag to show/hide the shadows in text in the canvas. It will be forced to false if the browser is IE

shadowOffsetX.C: Length in pixels for the shadow offset in the X axis

shadowOffsetY.C: Length in pixels for the shadow offset in the Y axis

shadowBlur.C: Amount in blur for the shadow

mapId.C: Map Id for the map div in the DOM

mapPropertyId.C: Map Property Id use to match the data ids to the GeoJSON layer Id

mapConfigFeatures.C: Map config for features use to translate and scale

visibleMapFeatures.C: Visible Map features. It Overrides the hidden features

mapOutlineColor.C: Color for the outline of the maps

mapMarkerShape.C: Default shape for the markers in map (if no shapeBy is specified

mapMarkerShapeScaleFactor.C: Scale factor for the marker shapes

mapLatitudeOrigin.C: Map Latitude Of Origin in degrees. (Applicable to Albers projection only). Default adjusts to USA maps

mapCentralMeridian.C: Map Latitude Of Origin in degrees. (Applicable to Albers projection only). Default adjusts to USA maps

mapStandardParallel1.C: Map Standard Parallel 1 in degrees. (Applicable to Albers projection only). Default adjusts to USA maps

adjustBezier.C: Flag to automatically select the bezier line type. the bezier can start from the top or bottom (vertical), or from the side (horizontal). This will be based on the location of the two points joined by the line

asSampleFactors.C: Array containing variable names. Numeric variable data (in rows) to be treated as a sample factor (move from y to x object). This parameter accomplishes the same as the function switchVarToAnnotation at load time. It can be used in conjunction with the parameter stringSampleFactors to be treated as a string. TO DO: write example

asVariableFactors.C: Array containing sample names. Numeric sample data (in columns) to be treated as a variable factor (move from y to z object). This parameter accomplishes the same as the function switchSmpToAnnotation at load time. It can be used in conjunction with the parameter stringVariableFactors to be treated as a string. TO DO: write example

stringSampleFactors.C: Array containing sample factors. The numeric sample factors will be treated as strings. This parameter accomplishes the same as the function switchNumericToString for samples at load time. It can be used in conjunction with the parameter asSampleFactors. TO DO: write example

stringVariableFactors.C: Array containing variable factors. The numeric variable factors will be treated as strings. This parameter accomplishes the same as the function switchNumericToString for variables at load time. It can be used in conjunction with the parameter asVariableFactors. TO DO: write example

stringNodeAttributes.C: Array containing node attributes. The numeric node attributes will be treated as strings. This parameter accomplishes the same as the function switchNumericToString for nodes at load time

stringEdgeAttributes.C: Array containing edge attributes. The numeric edge attributes will be treated as strings. This parameter accomplishes the same as the function switchNumericToString for edges at load time

transformData.C: Default transformation type for ALL the data. Data can also be transformed by axis (x,y,z) to give more flexibility. false, save, reset and undo are NOT real transformations. They are only used in the canvasXpress UIs to save the transformed data

transformAxis.C: Default axis to use to transform the data when either z-score or ratio transformation is used

ratioReference.C: Default index of sample used in ratio transformation. Almost private parameters used within the different CanvasXpress UIs

ratioSampleReference.C: Name of the sample used in ratio transformation. Almost private parameters used within the different CanvasXpress UIs

ratioLevelReference.C: Name of the level used in ratio transformation. Almost private parameters used within the different CanvasXpress UIs

segregateSamplesBy.C: An array that holds the annotation(s) used to segregate the samples ala Facet way in R. It must be categories in the data.x object

segregateVariablesBy.C: An array that holds the annotation(s) used to segregate the variables ala Facet way in R. It must be categories in the data.z object

splitSamplesBy.C: Factor (in the x data object) used to split the samples ala split in complex heatmap

splitVariablesBy.C: Factor (in the z data object) used to separate the variables ala split in complex heatmap

splitSeparation.C: Length in pixels to separate the splits in samples and variables

timeFormat.C: Time Format according to date.format.js Steven Levithan

isGraphTime.C: Flag to indicate if the data is a time series so there is no need to plot every time interval. It is boolean in one dimensional plots or a string indicating the axis which is timed x, y or z

sortDir.C: Default direction for data sorting. Almost private parameters used within the different CanvasXpress UIs

sortCaseSensitive.C: Whether to use case sensitive in ascii sorting. Almost private parameters used within the different CanvasXpress UIs

sortData.C: Array of arrays with sorting functions. Each function takes three parameters. The first parameter must be either smp to identify the parameters are related to the samples, var to identify the parameters are related to the variables, or cat to identify a sample or variable category. The second parameter can be either smp to indicate to sort the sample indices or var to indicate to sort the variable indices. The third parameter is the value for the key referenced by the first parameter. A special case for this parameter could be samples or variables to indicate to sort by the names of the samples or variables respectively. Here are some examples to sort the samples in the data: [ [cat, smp, Factor1] ] : Sort the samples by the sample category Factor1 [ [var, smp, Variable1] ] : Sort the samples by the value of the Variable1 [ [cat, smp, samples] ] : Sort the samples by their name. Important!!!! This parameter will clean the data and remove any variables not used in the dataset at load time

sortOnGrouping.C: Sort the name of the groups after sample grouping.

missingDataValue.C: String value use to specify missing data

nanOmit.C: Flag to omit NaN values in log transformation

axisExtension.C: Percentage to extend the values of the data to ensure all the data points are plotted inside and not over the edges of the graph

axisAlgorithm.C: Algorithm used to position tick labels on axes. See An Extension of Wilkinsons Algorithm for Positioning Tick Labels on Axes. Justin Talbot, Sharon Lin, Pat Hanrahan

axisWilkinsonLoose.C: Flag to indicate whether to use loose positioning when using the wilkinson algorithm to position the labels on the axis. There will not be a difference most of the times

axisCoordinate.C: Flag to coordinate xAxis and xAxis2 in *-Line combination plots

guides.C: This is a thin line that appears in the middle of the variables and / or samples in one dimensional graphs and multidimensional heatmaps just for aesthetics

guidesWidth.C: The width for the thin line that appears in the middle of the variables and / or samples in one dimensional graphs and multidimensional heatmaps just for aesthetics

guidesColor.C: Color for the thin line that appears in the middle of the variables and / or samples in one dimensional graphs and multidimensional heatmaps just for aesthetics

blockContrast.C: A flag to creates a shade between the samples so there are two backgrounds, one for the odd samples and one for the even samples

plotByVariable.C: Flag to indicate whether to group the data variable rather than by sample

is3DPlot.C: Flag to create or not a 3D plot

showDataValues.C: Flag to show/hide the data values in the one bar graphs

binned.C: Flag to bin the data points in dotplots and boxplots

binAlignment.C: Alignment for the data points when binned

jitter.C: Flag to jitter the data points in dotplots, boxplots and scatter2D plots

jitterFactor.C: Factor for jittering. The larger the more jitter

sina.C: Flag to jitter the data points in dotplots, boxplots and scatter2D plots with sina style

objectBorderColor.C: Color for the border of all objects in one dimensional graphs. It turns into the non-transparent fill color if set to false

objectColorTransparency.C: The transparency for the color fill of all objects in one dimensional graphs. A value between 0 and 1

dotplotOutlineThreshold.C: Maximum number of data points before skipping plotting their outline but only the fill color

linesOnGroups.C: Flag to create lines on groups when multiple grouping factors are used

lineDecoration.C: Lines decorations in the line graphs

lineErrorType.C: Line error type in the line graphs. The line type must be spline for the area error type.

coordinateLineColor.C: Flag to used same color in BarLine plots. If set to true the color of the bars and the lines will be coordinated

lineType.C: Type of line used to join the points in line graphs

tension.C: Curvature for the splines and hulls

tensionSegments.C: Number of segments to smooth a quadratic curve

boxplotOutliersRatio.C: Ratio for the size of the outliers with respect to boxplot

boxplotOutliersColor.C: Color for the outlier data points in boxplots

boxplotOutliersBorderColor.C: Color for the border of outlier data points in boxplots

boxplotOutliersShape.C: Shape for the outlier data points

boxplotTransparency.C: Fraction to adjust color transparency for the boxplot id individual data points are shown

boxplotColor.C: Color for the boxplot if individual data points are shown

boxplotVarWidth.C: Flag to adjust the width of boxplots. Similar to R if true then the width is proportional to the sqare root of the number of observations

boxplotCoef.C: Number that determines how far the plot whiskers extend out from the box

boxplotHingeFunction.C: Function to calculate the boxplor hinges. See https://chemicalstatistician.wordpress.com/2013/08/12/exploratory-data-analysis-the-5-number-summary-two-different-methods-in-r-2/

showBoxplotOriginalData.C: Flag to show/hide the observed data point in boxplots. (Should be called showBoxplotDataPoints)

boxplotDataPointTransparency.C: Fraction to adjust color transparency for the data points when displaying original data in boxplots

boxplotBorderColor.C: Color for the line of the borders in boxplots

boxplotMedianColor.C: Color for the line of the median of data in boxplots

boxplotMedianWidth.C: Width for the line of the median of data in boxplots

boxplotMean.C: Flag to show mean of data in boxplots

boxplotMeanColor.C: Color for the data mean in boxplots

boxplotMeanBorderColor.C: Color for the border of the data mean in boxplots

boxplotConnect.C: Flag to show data in boxplots connected

boxplotConnectWidth.C: Width for the line of the connection of boxes in boxplots

showViolinBoxplot.C: Flag to show/hide the violin plot in boxplots

showBoxplotIfViolin.C: Flag to show/hide the boxplots when violin plot are show. It does not affect anything unless violins are shown

boxplotWidthRatioIfViolin.C: A number between 0.1 and 1 to adjust the width of the boxplot when violins are shown. It does not affect anything unless violins are shown

violinTransparency.C: Fraction to adjust color transparency for the violins

violinColor.C: Color for the violins. If specified all the violins will have the assigned color; otherwise it will be automatically assigned

showViolinQuantiles.C: Flag to show/hide the quantile 0.25 and 0.75 in violin plots

areaType.C: Flag to produce normal, stacked, center or percent area graphs

dotplotType.C: Flag to produce normal, stacked or movement dotplot graphs. Movement plot are only applicable when data is grouped

barType.C: Flag to produce normal or lollipop bar graphs

barPath.C: Show the path for the bar graph

barPathTransparency.C: Transparency for the bar graph path

barPathColor.C: Color for the bar graph path. If false, it will default to the color of the graph

barLollipopFactor.C: Ratio for the top (dot) of the lollipop in bar graphs. The higher the value the bigger the lollipop. See widthFactor to adjust the bar width (choose a value between 0.5 and 0.6)

swimHigh.C: Variable to use in Swimmer plot. Defaults to the first variable in the data set. See https://blogs.sas.com/content/graphicallyspeaking/2014/06/22/swimmer-plot/

swimStart.C: Variable to use in Swimmer Plot. Defaults to the second variable in the data set. See https://blogs.sas.com/content/graphicallyspeaking/2014/06/22/swimmer-plot/

swimEnd.C: Variable to use in Swimmer Plot. Defaults to the third variable in the data set. See https://blogs.sas.com/content/graphicallyspeaking/2014/06/22/swimmer-plot/

swimStatus.C: Name of sample annotation to use in Swimmer Plot. Defaults to Status. See https://blogs.sas.com/content/graphicallyspeaking/2014/06/22/swimmer-plot/

swimHighCap.C: Name of sample annotation to use in Swimmer Plot. Defaults to High Cap. See https://blogs.sas.com/content/graphicallyspeaking/2014/06/22/swimmer-plot/

ganttStart.C: Variable to use in Gantt plots as start date. Defaults to the first variable in the data set

ganttEnd.C: Variable to use in Gantt plots as end date. Defaults to the second variable in the data set

ganttCompletion.C: Variable annotation in the x object to use in Gantt plots as completion percentage. Must be a value between 0 and 1

ganttDependency.C: Variable annotation in the x object to use in Gantt plots as dependency. Must be a valid sample / group name

ganttDependencyEnd.C: Variable annotation for the type of ending for the dependency line. Options are arrow, square or round

ganttDependencyColor.C: Color for the variable metadata used for the dependency line. Defaults to rgb(0,0,0)

ganttDependencyThickness.C: Variable annotation for the thickness of the dependency line. Defaults to 1

ganttCompletionTransparency.C: Fraction to adjust color transparency for completion

meterStart.C: Start value for the meter in degrees

meterEnd.C: End value for the meter in degrees

meterVar.C: Name of the variable use to create the meter. The first variable will be used if not specified or if it is non-valid

meterGroup.C: Name of the sample category to use to create the meters

meterSummary.C: Summary to calculate for the meters

meterTopology.C: Topology set up for the meters

meterNeedleColor.C: Color for the Meter Needle Color

meterBackgroundColor.C: Color for the Meter Background Color

meterThickness.C: Thickness in pixels for the vertical, horizontal and state meters

fishAxisLabels.C: Fish Axis Labels (array with names for the lines across the X Axis). Must have the same dimension as the fishAxis

fishCloneLabels.C: Fish Clone Labels (array with names for the clones). Must have the same dimension as the fishParents

treeInverted.C: Flag to plot the tree inverted

variableShowLegend.C: Flag to show the variable legend

sampleShowLegend.C: Flag to show the sample legend. Not implemented!!!!!

colorBy.C: Name of a variable annotation or a sample name or the string variable to color the variables

colorByShowLegend.C: Flag to show the colorBy legend

colorKey.C: Object to assign custom colors to sample annotations and variable annotations included in the data object. The key of the object is the name of an annotation in the data.x object, or the name of an annotation in the data.z object. The value for each key could be either: (1) a scalar with a valid color scheme (see this.meta.def.colorSchemes), or (2) an array with valid colors, or (3) an object to specify custom colors for each of the values of the annotation. A default color will be assigned to a data point whose value was not included the object. CanvasXpress will handle string and numeric annotation approprietly. However, if an object is specified like that one in number (3) the annotation will be treated as categorical even if the annotation is numeric

colorByData.C: String that identify the object containing a two dimensional array with discrete values used to color data points when drawing a multidimensional Heatmap. It must be located within the data.y object (for example: data.y.data2)

shapeBy.C: Name of a variable annotation or a sample name or the string variable to shape the variables. When shapeByData is specified shapeBy is used for the title in the legend

shapeByContinuous.C: Flag to use pie shapes with continuous data as opposed to by binning the data and show regular shapes

shapeByShowLegend.C: Flag to show the shapeBy legend

shapeKey.C: Object to assign custom shapes to sample annotations and variable annotations included in the data object. The key of the object is the name of an annotation in the data.x object or the name of an annotation in the data.z object. A default shape will be assigned to a data point whose value was not included the object

shapeByData.C: String that identify the object containing a two dimensional array with values used to shape data points when drawing a multidimensional Heatmap. It must be located within the data.y object (for example: data.y.data2)

shapeByShape.C: String that identify the shape to use in regular and multidimensional heatmaps. shapeByData will take precedence over this property

sizeBy.C: Name of a variable annotation or a sample name or the string variable to size the variables. When sizeByData is specified sizeBy is used for the title in the legend

sizeByContinuous.C: Flag to show the size data continuously as opposed to by binning the sizes

sizeByShowLegend.C: Flag to show the sizeBy legend

sizeKey.C: Object to assign custom sizes to sample annotations and variable annotations included in the data object. The key of the object is the name of an annotation in the data.x object or the name of an annotation in the data.z object. A default size will be assigned to a data point whose value was not included the object

sizeByData.C: String that identify the object containing a two dimensional array with values used to size data points when drawing a multidimensional Heatmap. It must be located within the data.y object (for example: data.y.data3)

outlineBy.C: Name of the annotation for the outline when drawing a multidimensional Heatmap

outlineByShowLegend.C: Flag to show the outlineBy legend

outlineByData.C: String that identify the object containing a two dimensional array with values used to color the outline data points when drawing a multidimensional Heatmap. It must be located within the data.y object (for example: data.y.data4)

patternBy.C: Name of a variable annotation or a sample name or the string variable to pattern the variables. When patternByData is specified patternBy is used for the title in the legend

patternByShowLegend.C: Flag to show the patternBy legend

patternKey.C: Object to assign custom patterns to sample annotations and variable annotations included in the data object. The key of the object is the name of an annotation in the data.x object or the name of an annotation in the data.z object. A default pattern will be assigned to a data point whose value was not included the object

patternByData.C: String that identify the object containing a two dimensional array with values used to pattern the data points when drawing a multidimensional Heatmap. It must be located within the data.y object (for example: data.y.data4)

connectBy.C: Name of a variable annotation to connect the variables

connectByNoColor.C: Flag to prevent coloring the lines by the connectBy annotation. Usefull when connectBy is used along with colorBy to avoid confusion of colors

connectByWidth.C: Width for the line of the connectBy line

connectByShowLegend.C: Flag to show the connectBy legend

connectKey.C: Object to assign custom colors to lines when samples are connected by a sample annotations included in the data object. The key of the object is the name of an annotation in the data.x object. A default connect will be assigned to a data point whose value was not included the object

treemapBy.C: Array of sample annotations to treemap the variables. The array may also include sample to use as last level

stackBy.C: Name of a sample annotation to stack the samples of each variable in Bar graphs

dodgeBy.C: Name of a sample annotation to dodge the samples of each variable in Bar graphs

lineBy.C: Name of a sample annotation to stack the samples of each variable in Line graphs

lineByShowLegend.C: Flag to show the lineBy legend

ribbonBy.C: Name of a sample annotation(s) to create a ribbon of each variable in scatter plots. If a single annotation is passed then it will be used as a standard deviation. If two annotations are passed then, it will be used as upper and lower confidence intervals. Alternatively it could be a pair of arrays witht the actual data. Works in coordination with the lineBy parameter

motionBy.C: Utility to create dynamic filtering of data in Scatter plots

markerBy.C: Utility to create dynamic markers in Map. It must have a latitude and longitude metadata too

ellipseBy.C: Utility to create error ellipses in Scatter plots

confidenceBy.C: Name of a variable annotation to color the confidence intervals

ridgeBy.C: Utility to create ridgelines in Scatter2D plots

colorLabelBy.C: Name of the variable annotation to color the labels in Scatter2D plots

colorLabelByShowLegend.C: Flag to show the colorLabelBy legend

sizeLabelBy.C: Name of the variable annotation to size the labels in Scatter2D plots

sizeLabelByShowLegend.C: Flag to show the sizeLabelBy legend

motionWidth.C: Size in pixels for the motion widget when used to reproduce user customizations

motionCurrentFontStyle.C: Font style for the motion charts

motionCurrentColor.C: Color for the text in motion charts

motionCurrentFontSize.C: Font size for the text in motion charts. Be aware that auto scaling font must be turned off for this property to take effect. A more convenient way to modify the size is to use the motionCurrentScaleFontFactor

motionCurrentScaleFontFactor.C: Scaling factor used to increase or decrease the motion charts font size in the canvas

motionCurrentRotate.C: Rotation in degrees for the motion charts

scatterLineAlpha.C: Transparency applied to lines in scatter plots

scatterPointAlpha.C: Thickness applied to data points in scatter plots

groupingFactorWindow.C: The width for the data when grouping in Scatter2D plots. This is the analogous parameter to cut_width in R. It defaults to a fifth of the data range. The scatterType must be boxplot to take this parameter into effect

showDataLabels.C: Flag to show/hide the data labels in scatter plots

isDataLabels.C: Flag to put a background in data labels

isDataLabelsBackgroundColor.C: Flag to use the color in the colorDataLabels as a background in data labels

dataLabelBackgroundColor.C: Color for the data labels background

dataLabelBackgroundBorderColor.C: Color for the border in data labels background

dataLabelBackgroundBorderSize.C: Size for the border line in data labels background

dataLabelBackgroundBorderLineType.C: Type of line for the border in data labels background

scatterAxesEqual.C: Keep same range in both axes

scatterOutlineThreshold.C: Maximum number of data points before skipping plotting their outline but only the fill color

scatterStreamBandwidth.C: Scatter stream bandwidth. Tensor for the wiggles of the stream wiggles. A vaulue between 0 and 1

scatterStreamNumber.C: Number of values for the wiggles

scatterStreamExtraSpan.C: Scatter stream extra extension for the wiggles. A vaulue between 0 and 1 as in percent

visiumFlip.C: Invert the data in visium plots.

visiumPanning.C: No panning on visium plots so dragging will always zoom

visiumFixedAspectRatio.C: Fix aspect ratio for visium plots

chromosomeLengths.C: Manhattan Chromosomes length is a sorted array by chromosome with the length in base pairs for each chromosome. It is required when scatterType is manhattan

manhattanMarkerChromosomeNumber.C: Sample name included in the data.y.smps object used to map to the chromosome number

manhattanMarkerPosition.C: Sample name included in the data.y.smps object used to map to the position in base pairs

manhattanMarkerLogPValue.C: Sample name included in the data.y.smps object used to map to the negative log 10 p value

selectionMode.C: Mode use to highlight selected data points in visualizations

selectionColor.C: Color for the The color used for selected data points when selection mode is to be highlight

selectionMetadata.C: Matadata (or factor) to use to display selected data points instead of the variable name. This metadata has to be in the data.z object. This property is only valid when the selectionMode is name and the visualization is a Scatter plot

selectedDataPoints.C: Variable / Sample names of data points (in the data object) to initially select

contourFilled.C: Flag to color the contour plot

contourFilledTransparency.C: Transparency applied to the filled contours

showContourBands.C: Flag to show/hide the contour bands

contourBandsColor.C: Color for the the bands in contours

contourLevelNumber.C: Numbe of contour levels. Overridden by contourLevelWidth

contourLevels.C: Numeric vector to set the contour levels. It is automatically calculated if not defined using the axisAlgorithm setting and the contourLevelNumber

showContourLevel.C: Flag to show/hide the levels in contours

showContourDataPoints.C: Flag to show/hide the data points in contours

contourDataPointsColor.C: Color for the data points in contours when the contour is filled

contourColorScheme.C: Color scheme to use in contours

showHistogram.C: Flag or sample annotation to create histogram. If true is specified then the histogram will be done with all data

histogramRight.C: Histogram right is a boolean. If true, the histogram cells are right-closed (left open) intervals

histogramLowest.C: Histogram lowest is a boolean. If true, an x[i] equal to the breaks value will be included in the first (or last, for right = FALSE) bar

histogramBins.C: Approximate number of bins in a histogram. It may vary to the actual number used in the histogram to ensure a pretty size for the intervals in the histogram. Default is the same as in ggplot which is 30

histogramBreaks.C: Numeric vector to set the histogram breaks. It is automatically calculated if not defined using the axisAlgorithm setting and the histogramBins

histogramBinWidth.C: Width in actual units for the histogram bin

histogramType.C: Type of histogram when multiple series are present

showHistogramDensity.C: Flag to show/hide the density kernel in histograms

showHistogramPath.C: Flag to show/hide the histograms path

showFilledHistogramPath.C: Flag to show/hide the filled histogram path

histogramPathFillTransparency.C: Transparency applied to the filled histogram path

histogramPathColor.C: Color for the histogram path. If not specified the it defaults to the color of the histogram bars

histogramPathWidth.C: Width for the line of the histogram path line

showFilledHistogramDensity.C: Flag to show/hide the filled histogram density

histogramDensityFillTransparency.C: Transparency applied to the filled histogram density

showHistogramDataPoints.C: Flag to show/hide the original data point in histograms

showHistogramQuantiles.C: Flag to show/hide the quantile 0.25 and 0.75 in density plots

showHistogramMedian.C: Flag to show/hide the histogram median

histogramMedianLineType.C: Line type for the histogram median

hideHistogram.C: Flag to hide the histogram bars

histogramAsDotplot.C: Flag to use dots as histogram bars

histogramDotplotColor.C: Color for the data points in dotplot histograms

histogramDotplotBorderColor.C: Color for the border in data points in dotplot histograms

histogramDotplotBorderSize.C: Size for the border line in data points in dotplot histograms

histogramDotplotBorderLineType.C: Type of line for the border in data points in dotplot histograms

histogramStackRatio.C: Stack ratio for dotplot histograms. I has to be a value between 0 and 1

histogramStackDir.C: Direction to stack the dots in dotplot histograms

showScatterDensity.C: Flag to show/hide the density kernel in histograms

fitLineTransparency.C: Transparency for the color of the fit line

fitLineType.C: Type of line for the fit line

fitLineShow.C: Flag to show/hide the fit line

showConfidenceIntervals.C: Flag to show/hide the confidence intervals in the regression plots

confidenceLevel.C: Confidence level for regressions and ellipses

confidenceIntervalColorCoordinate.C: Flag to color coordinate the confidence intervals and line fit

showRegressionFit.C: Flag to show/hide the Flag to show the regression fit in Scatter2D plots

showRegressionFitEquation.C: Flag to show/hide the Flag to show the regression fit equation in Scatter2D plots

regressionFitEquationPosition.C: Position for the regression fit equation in Scatter2D plots

showRegressionFullRange.C: Flag to show/hide the full range in regression plots

regressionType.C: Type of linear least-squares fitting methods for simple data analysis

regressionOrder.C: Specifies the number of degrees to solve for in polynomial regressions

showLoessFit.C: Flag to show/hide the Flag to show the loess fit in Scatter2D plots

loessSteps.C: Loess steps. Number of steps to smooth the line

loessBandwidth.C: Loess bandwidth. Thickness for the confidence of the loess curve. A vaulue between 0 and 1

loessCell.C: Loess cell. If interpolation is used this controls the accuracy of the approximation via the maximum number of points in a cell in the kd tree. Cells with more than floor(n*span*cell) points are subdivided

loessSpan.C: Loess span. Factor to adjust the gaussian shape of the loess curve. A vaulue between 0 and 1

loessNormalize.C: Flag to normalize loess fit in Scatter2D plots

loessFamily.C: Loess Family. Type of error distribution to be optimized in fitting. The default, gaussian, is fitting with least squares. Fitting with Tukeys biweight M-Estimator is used if family is symmetric

loessSurface.C: Loess Surface. The fitted surface to be computed exactly (direct) or via interpolation from a kd tree

loessStatistics.C: LoessStatistics. The statistics to be computed exactly, approximately or not at all? Exact computation can be very slow

showKMConfidenceIntervals.C: Flag to show/hide the confidence intervals in Kaplan-Meier plots

kmConfidenceLevel.C: Confidence level for Kaplan Meier plots

kmConfidenceIntervalType.C: Confidence intervals type for Kaplan Meier estimates

kmInvertCensored.C: Flag to indicate whether zero values are censored or not in Kaplan-Meier plots

kmCensoredRug.C: Flag to indicate whether to show the censored data as a rug in Kaplan-Meier plots

kmTable.C: Data to show in Kaplan-Meier plots. It must be a numeric factor as it will be aligned to the major ticks in the x Axis

quantiles.C: Array with quantiles to use in quantile regression plots

showQuantileRegressionFit.C: Flag to show/hide the Quantile Regression fit in Scatter2D plots

binplotBins.C: Approximate number of bins in a bin plot. It may vary considerably to the actual number used in the bin plot to ensure a pretty size for the intervals in the bin plot. ggplots default is 30

binplotBinWidth.C: Width in actual units for the histogram bin

binplotDrop.C: Flag to drop cells with zero counts in binplots

binplotShape.C: Type for the shape to use in binplots

binplotColorScheme.C: Color scheme to use in binplots

maxDOENumber.C: Maximum number of graphs when creating a DOE

includeDOE.C: Array containing the factors to include when exploring the DOE. If left empty all the factors will be included

autoexpandDOE.C: Flag to automatically expand verticaly the extent of the meta data-plots when changing the size of the graphs

extendedDOE.C: Flag to extend DOE to include variables / samples

asDOE.C: Object with configurations to create DOE

scatterPlotMatrix.C: Could be a boolean to plot a matrix of 2D scatterplots or a sample annotation to color and segregate the plots

scatterPlotMatrixType.C: Type for the matrix of 2D scatterplots. Draw either in both panels, upper only or lower only. Show any combination of correlation, histogram, density and variability (boxplots). Also specify whether to use all versus all or only the first data set

showScatterPlotMatrixLabels.C: Flag to show/hide the labels in the scatter plot matrix

xRotate.C: Starting number of degrees to rotate graph arround the X axis

yRotate.C: Starting number of degrees to rotate graph arround the Y axis

zRotate.C: Starting number of degrees to rotate graph arround the Z axis

x3DRatio.C: Value between 0 - 1 for adjusting the 3D of the X Axis

y3DRatio.C: Value between 0 - 1 for adjusting the 3D of the Y Axis

z3DRatio.C: Value between 0 - 1 for adjusting the 3D of the Z Axis

show3DGrid.C: Flag to show/hide the X,Y,Z grid in 3D plots

rotationSensitivity.C: Factor to adjust the sensitivity of the mouse when rotating the graph

rotationStep.C: Number of degrees used when the plot is automatically rotated

perspectiveFactor.C: Factor to use to make the 3D perspective. The higher the number the more perspective. Perspective of zero is no perspective at all

outline3DColor.C: Color for the outline of the 3D Scatters

heatmapAutoAdjust.C: Flag to adjust the color spectrum of the heatmaps when zooming in/out. The full spectrum range will be utilized to cover the selcted cells in the heatmap if the flag is set to true

heatmapCellBox.C: Flag to print a box around the heatmap cells

heatmapCellBoxColor.C: Color for the heatmap boxes around the cells

heatmapCellBoxWidth.C: Width for the heatmap boxes around the cells

heatmapCellBoxColorHighlight.C: Color for the highlighted heatmap cells

heatmapCellBoxHighlightWidth.C: Width for the highlighting heatmap boxes around the cells

heatmapType.C: Type of Heatmap used to overlay a layer on top of an image. Special for spatial transcriptomics and UpSet plots

heatmapCollapse.C: Flag to collapse cells in heatmaps of type circle or hexagon. If true cells are ploted without outline otherwise the outline is the foreground color

showHeatmapIndicator.C: Flag to show/hide the heatmap color indicator

heatmapIndicatorHeight.C: Length in pixels for the heatmap indicator

heatmapIndicatorWidth.C: Length in pixels for the heatmap indicator line width used for increase the size of the indicator

adjustAspectRatioHeatmapIndicator.C: Flag to ensure the heatmap indicator scales appropriately when the graph is rendered or the user manually resizes the graph, the adjustAspectRatio flag must be set to true for the adjustAspectRatioHeatmapIndicator to take effect

heatmapIndicatorBeforeOverlays.C: Flag to place the heatmap indicator before the overlay legends

heatmapIndicatorHistogram.C: Flag to show histogram in the heatmap indicator

heatmapIndicatorHistogramColor.C: Color for the heatmap indicator histogram

oncoprintCNA.C: String to identify the data object to use to draw the copy number alterations; that is the amplifications (which will be colored red) and deletions (which will be colored blue). It MUST be a file with only two categorical levels

oncoprintMUT.C: String to identify the data object to use to draw the mutations. For example missense, non-synonymous, truncating, etc. Each level will be colored in a shade of green

oncoprintHeatmapSwitch.C: Switch to Oncoprint or Heatmap visualization. Requieres data in the data object

oncoprintNoAlterations.C: Switch to show variables and samples without any alterations

oncoprintColSummary.C: Flag to show column summary in oncoprints

oncoprintRowSummary.C: Flag to show row summary in oncoprints

showHeatmapOncoprint.C: Flag to show/hide the heatmap along with the oncoprint

oncoprintHeatmapPosition.C: Position for the heatmap in the oncoprint

upSetSets.C: Array containing the names of the sets to include

upSetIntercepts.C: Array containing the names of the intercepts to include. Sets must be separated by &&

upsetShadeColor.C: Color for the row shading in matrix

upsetMatrixDotAlpha.C: Transparency of the empty intersections points in the matrix

upsetMatrixColor.C: Color for the the intersection points

upsetMainBarColor.C: Color for the the main bar plot

upsetSetsBarColor.C: Color for the set bar plot

upsetPointSizeFactor.C: Adjust the size of points in matrix plot

upsetLineSizeFactor.C: Adjust width of lines in matrix plot

upsetMatrixPlotBarRatio.C: Ratio between matrix plot and main bar plot

treemapBorderColor.C: Color for the treemap header and border

correlationAnchorLegend.C: Flag to show a region above the correlation plot that anchror a sample/variable to a position

correlationAnchorLegendAlignWidth.C: Length in pixels of the height of the correlation anchor legend

correlationLabelInterval.C: Interval for the sample or variable labels in the correlation plot

correlationType.C: Shape to use in the correlation graphs

showVarDendrogram.C: Flag to show/hide the variable dendrogram

varDendrogramNewick.C: Custom dendrogram in Newick format produced outside CanvasXpress to specify hierarchy for the variable dendrogram.

varDendrogramPosition.C: Position for the variable dendrogram in the plot. It could be top, bottom, right or left depending on the orientation of the graph

colorVarDendrogramBy.C: Name of metadata annotation to color the variable dendrogram

showSmpDendrogram.C: Flag to show/hide the sample dendrogram

smpDendrogramNewick.C: Custom dendrogram in Newick format produced outside CanvasXpress to specify hierarchy for the sample dendrogram.

smpDendrogramPosition.C: Position for the sample dendrogram in the plot. It could be top, bottom, right or left depending on the orientation of the graph

colorSmpDendrogramBy.C: Name of metadata annotation to color the sample dendrogram

dendrogramHeight.C: Size in pixels for the dendrogram

clusteringDistance.C: Distance metric to use when clustering data

linkage.C: Linkage type to use when clustering data

clusterAxis.C: Axis to use when clustering data

kmeansVarClusters.C: Number of clusters when clustering variable data with kmeans

kmeansSmpClusters.C: Number of clusters when clustering sample data with kmeans

maxIterations.C: Number of maximum iterations when clustering data with kmeans for one dimensional graphs or maximum number of iterations when calculating force direct layout networks

imputeMethod.C: Imputation method for missing data when clustering

vennLegendColors.C: Flag to use the venn colors to use for the legends instead of the letters

vennGroups.C: Number of groups in the Venn diagram

vennColors.C: Colors for the Venn bubles. If not specified the colors will be chosen from the colors array. Colors in this array need to be at least the same number of groups in the Venn diagram

pieType.C: Position for the pices of the pie

pieSegmentPrecision.C: Number of decimals for values in the Pie charts

pieSegmentSeparation.C: Length in pixels for the separation of the pieces of the pie charts

pieSegmentLabels.C: Location for the values in the pie charts

pieLabelType.C: Pie label type to show the percentage of the slice or the actual number

maxPieSectors.C: Max pie sectors. After that number the sectors will be put in a sector named other

showPieValues.C: Flag to show/hide the values for the pie

showPieSampleLabel.C: Flag to show/hide the sample label when plotting multiple pies

startPieSectors.C: Starting degrees for pie sectors. 0 is equivalent to 3:00 oclock

pieInnerRadius.C: Percentage of the radius in the pies to remove to make a donut. It must be a number between 0 to 1

pieColors.C: Pie Colors. Defaults to the parameter colors

circularType.C: Property to set the subtype of circular graph. If set to sunburst or bubble then smpOverlays can be used to build a hierarchy for the graph

chordThickness.C: Relative length in pixels of the chord thickness in the circular graphs. Only applicable to the chord subtype

chordColor.C: Color the ribbon according to either the source or the target of the connection

bubbleColor.C: Color for the Bubbles. Only applicable to the bubble subtype

bubbleOutlineColor.C: Color for the Outline of bubbles. Only applicable to the bubble subtype

bubbleLabel.C: Position for the labels in bubble circular plot

bubbleLabelPosition.C: Position for the labels in bubble circular plot

bubbleLabelLineType.C: Line type when label is away from the bubble

circularCenterProportion.C: Proportion of the center of the circular graph to use as void; that is the fraction of the radius in the middle of the graph

arcSegmentsSeparation.C: Number of degrees to separate the arc segments in the circular plots. The arc segments can be set with the segregateSampleBy property

circularRotate.C: Number of degrees to rotate the circular graph to adjust the starting point

circularArc.C: Number of degrees to extend the circular graph

ringSeparation.C: Number of pixels to separate the rings in the circular plots

ringGraphType.C: Array containing the graph type for each ring in the circular plot

ringGraphWeight.C: Array containing the proportion of the dimensions for each data ring in the circular plot. It must be a value between 0.1 and 1. If not specified then all ring will be weighted the same

arcSegmentsRadius.C: Array containing the proportion of the radius for each arc segment in the circular plot. If not specified then all radius will be the same. The plot will be scaled based of the largest value in the array

ringsOrder.C: Array containing the order of the rings. The array includes the levels of the factor specified as either segregateSamplesBy when show the ideogram or segregateVariablesBy when there is no ideogram. It may also include any of the following terms: dendrogram, ideogram, labels, scale, percent and data. If there are sample overlays, the array may also contain any of the factor names include in the this.data.x object. This array supersede any other configurations for example for the sample overlays. CanvasXpress will honored all other configurations if left empty

rAxis.C: Radial axis for circular plots. It must be the name of a variable. Only applicable to 2 Dimensional circular plots

rAxisZero.C: Flag to force the rAxis property to start from zero otherwise it starts from the minimum value

showCircularConnections.C: Flag to show/hide the connections in circular graphs

connections.C: Array to store connections in circular graphs

circularLetterSeparationFactor.C: Factor to adjust the spacing between letters in the circular graphs. The greater the number the closer the letters in the labels

circularConnectionsTransparency.C: Percentage of transparency applied to the connections in the circular graphs

overlayLevelOrientation.C: Orientation to show the segregation levels

smpLabelOrientation.C: Orientation to show the sample names

circularLabelsAlign.C: Position to align the variable and sample names in circular plot

circularScalesAlign.C: Position to align the percent and radial axes in circular plot

circularAnchorsAlign.C: Position to align the anchors in circular plot

circularAnchors2Align.C: Position to align the anchors2 in circular plot

circularDataPosition.C: Position to align the data in 2D radial graphs and ideograms

circularAnchorLength.C: Length in pixels of the height of the circular anchor

ideogramChromosome.C: Factor name included in the data.z object used to map to the chromosome number

ideogramChromosomePosition.C: Factor name included in the data.z object used to map to the chromosome position

showIdeogram.C: Flag to show/hide the Human Chromosome Ideogram. Force circular plots to be two dimensional

ideogram.C:
Ideogram. Additional ideograms can be loaded by appending to the CanvasXpress.chromosomes object. The format of the ideogram is based on the R data for USCS.hg19.chr
CanvasXpress.chromosomes = {
  hg19 : {
    order : [ 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, ...],
    data : {
      1 : [ [ 0, 2300000, "p36.33", "gneg" ], ...],
      2 : [ [ 0, 4300000, "p25.3", "gneg" ], ...],
    }
  }
}

ideogramSegmentFontStyle.C: Font style for the ideogram segment

ideogramSegmentColor.C: Color for the text in ideogram segment

ideogramSegmentFontSize.C: Font size for the text in ideogram segment. Be aware that auto scaling font must be turned off for this property to take effect. A more convenient way to modify the size is to use the ideogramSegmentScaleFontFactor

ideogramSegmentScaleFontFactor.C: Scaling factor used to increase or decrease the ideogram segment font size in the canvas

ideogramSegmentRotate.C: Rotation in degrees for the ideogram segment

ideogramHeight.C: Default size in pixels of the ideogram height

tagCloudTextWeightFactor.C: Factor weight for text in tag cloud visualizations

tagCloudTextGridSize.C: Size for the grid in text tag cloud visualizations

tagCloudTextEllipticity.C: Ellipticity for the for text in tag cloud visualizations

tagCloudTextRotateRatio.C: Ratio for rotation of text in cloud visualizations

tagCloudMask.C: Add a shadow for the selected shape

calculateLayout.C: Flag to force or not to calculate the network layout

networkFreeze.C: Flag to prevent autoscaling for the network layout. Useful when images are part of the network

networkMaxIterations.C: Number of iterations to separate subnetworks

networkFreezeOnLoad.C: Flag to prevent autoscaling for the network layout after loading. Useful when images are part of the network

preScaleNetwork.C: Flag to prescale or not the network. This is an aesthetic parameter to make the graph look nicer... Sometimes..

ignoreEventlessOrder.C: Flag to render all nodes at one time rather that rendering first the eventless nodes and then the non-eventless nodes

networkRoot.C: Node Id of the network root

isNetworkMetrics.C: Flag to calculate all network metrics: betweenness, closeness, eccentricity and degree

showNetworkRadialLayout.C: Flag to show/hide the radial layout wire

is3DNetwork.C: Flag to create or not a 3D network

networkNodesOnTop.C: Order to use when drawing the nodes and edges in the networks. Useful for very populated netwrok graphs. When is set to true all the edges will be in the background

moveParentsWithChildren.C: Flag to make parents move when a child is moved

highlightNode.C: Name of nodes in the data.nodes object to highlight

showNodeNameThreshold.C: Thereshold used to set the limit to hide or display the name of nodes in a network. If the number of nodes exceed this thereshold then the name will not be shown

showNodeNameSizeThreshold.C: Thereshold used to set the limit to hide or display the name of nodes in a network based on the size of the node. If the number of node size exceed this thereshold then the name will be shown

nodeSizeScaleFactor.C: Scaling factor for increasing size of all nodes in the network

edgeSeparationFactor.C: Factor to adjust the separation between the edge and the node in the networks

labelNodePosition.C: Default position for the node label

nodeFontSize.C: Font size for the text in node. Be aware that auto scaling font must be turned off for this property to take effect. A more convenient way to modify the size is to use the nodeScaleFontFactor

nodeScaleFontFactor.C: Scaling factor used to increase or decrease the node font size in the canvas

nodeRotate.C: Rotation in degrees for the node

networkConvergenceThreshold.C: Threshold for the convergence of the network

attractiveForceFunction.C: Type of function to apply when calculating attractive force in forceDirected network layouts. Fruchterman-Reingold uses square while Eades uses log

repulsiveForceFunction.C: Type of function to apply when calculating repulsive force in forceDirected network layouts. Fruchterman-Reingold uses square while Eades uses log

networkDisjoint.C: Flag to use positioning forces rather than centering forces. Applicable only to force directed layouts that contain multiple subnetworks

networkSpringLength.C: Ideal length for links (springs in physical model)

networkRepulsion.C: Coulombs law coefficient. Its used to repel nodes thus should be negative if you make it positive nodes start attract each other

networkTheta.C: Theta coefficient from Barnes Hut simulation. Ranged between (0, 1). The closer its to 1 the more nodes algorithm will have to go through. Setting it to one makes Barnes Hut simulation no different from brute-force forces calculation (each node is considered)

networkDragCoeff.C: Drag force coefficient. Used to slow down system, thus should be less than 1. The closer it is to 0 the less tight system will be

networkTimeStep.C: Default time step (dt) for forces integration

networkColaAvoidOverlaps.C: Flag to avoid overlaps of nodes in the cola network

networkColaHandleDisconnected.C: Handle disconnected nodes in the cola network

networkColaConvergenceThreshold.C: Threshold for the convergence of the cola network

networkColaGroupCompactness.C: Compactness for the groups in the cola network

networkColaSymmetricDiffLinkLengths.C: Symmetric difference for the link lengths in the cola network

networkColaJaccardLinkLength.C: Ideal length foreach link based on the graph structure around that link. You can use this to create extra space around hub-nodes in dense graphs

networkColaJaccardLinkLengthDefault.C: Default length foreach link based on the graph structure around that link. You can use this to create extra space around hub-nodes in dense graphs

networkColaFlowLayoutAxis.C: Causes constraints to be generated such that directed graphs are laid out either from left-to-right or top-to-bottom. A separation constraint is generated in the selected axis for each edge that is not involved in a cycle

networkColaFlowLayoutSeparation.C: Causes constraints to be generated such that directed graphs are laid out either from left-to-right or top-to-bottom. A separation constraint is generated in the selected axis for each edge that is not involved in a cycle

networkColaStartUnconstrainedIterations.C: Number of iterations to run unconstrained

networkColaUserConstraintIterations.C: Number of user iterations to run unconstrained

networkColaAllConstraintsIterations.C: Number of iterations to run all constraints

networkColaGridSnapIterations.C: Number of iterations to run grid snap

networkColaKeepRunning.C: Flag to keep running the cola network

networkColaCenterGraph.C: Flag to center the cola network

colorNodeBy.C: Name of the attribute to color the nodes

shapeNodeBy.C: Name of the attribute to shape the nods

sizeNodeBy.C: Name of the attribute to size the nodes

patternNodeBy.C: Name of the attribute to pattern the nodes

colorEdgeBy.C: Name of the attribute to color the edges

sizeEdgeBy.C: Name of the attribute to size the edges

minEdgeSize.C: Number of pixels to add to the minimum thickness for the edges when the edges are sized by a property. Should be a value between 0 and 1.5

maxEdgeSize.C: Thickness for the edges when the edges are sized by a property. Should be a value between 10 and 20

showNetworkCommunities.C: Flag to show/hide the network communities

calculateNetworkCommunities.C: Flag to calculate the network communities using the jLouvain algorithm. If this flag is false the property community and communityColor for each node will need to be provided, otherwise all nodes will belong to a single community

coordinateNetworkConvexHullCommunityColo.C: Flag to coordinate colors of the nodes with convex hull for the network communities

hullScale.C: Scaling factor for extension of the hulls in the network communities

genomeTicks.C: Number of ticks in the genome browser

wireColor.C: Color for the ticks in the genome browser

periodTicksLabels.C: Number of ticks to skip between values in the genome browser

genomeResolution.C: Number to adjust the splines curvature

trackNameFontStyle.C: Font style for the track name

trackNameColor.C: Color for the text in track name

trackNameFontSize.C: Font size for the text in track name. Be aware that auto scaling font must be turned off for this property to take effect. A more convenient way to modify the size is to use the trackNameScaleFontFactor

trackNameScaleFontFactor.C: Scaling factor used to increase or decrease the track name font size in the canvas

trackNameRotate.C: Rotation in degrees for the track name

trackFillColor.C: Color for the fill of the tracks in the genome browser

trackDirColor.C: Color for the strand direction of the tracks in the genome browser

subtracksMaxDefault.C: Maximum number of subtracks to show in a track

showFeatureNameThereshold.C: Threshehold used to set te limit when there are too many features in the genome browser

featureNameFontStyle.C: Font style for the feature name

featureNameColor.C: Color for the text in feature name

featureNameFontSize.C: Font size for the text in feature name. Be aware that auto scaling font must be turned off for this property to take effect. A more convenient way to modify the size is to use the featureNameScaleFontFactor

featureNameScaleFontFactor.C: Scaling factor used to increase or decrease the feature name font size in the canvas

featureNameRotate.C: Rotation in degrees for the feature name

featureFillColor.C: Color for the fill of the feature in the genome browser

featureDirColor.C: Color for the strand direction of the feature in the genome browser

maxFeatureStringLen.C: Maximum length in characters a feature label can have so anything above is truncated

featureWidthDefault.C: Default size in pixels of the feature width

featureHeightDefault.C: Default size in pixels of the feature height

featureSpliceStyle.C: Default style for splicing in boxes

featureTraceHeight.C: Default size in pixels of the trace height

featureTraceTrim.C: Default triming for nucleotide values in the traces (expressed in percent)

featureQualityHeight.C: Default size in pixels of the quality height

featureQualityValues.C: Flag use to show values for the quality

featureSignalToNoiseHeight.C: Default size in pixels of the quality height

featureSignalToNoiseValues.C: Flag use to show values for the quality

featureCoordinateHeight.C: Default size in pixels of the coordinates height

featureTranslateHeight.C: Default size in pixels of the translation height

featureTypeDefault.C: Default type for the feature in the genome browser

featureStaggered.C: Flag use to stagger the features in the genome panel

featureConfigurableProperties.C:
Feature configurable properties
@features {id:[string];Feature id;[],fill:[color];Color for the feature;[]}

sequenceColor.C: Color for the text in sequence

sequenceFontSize.C: Font size for the text in sequence. Be aware that auto scaling font must be turned off for this property to take effect. A more convenient way to modify the size is to use the sequenceScaleFontFactor

sequenceScaleFontFactor.C: Scaling factor used to increase or decrease the sequence font size in the canvas

sequenceRotate.C: Rotation in degrees for the sequence

sequenceFillColor.C: Color for the background when showing sequnces in the box or sequence object in the Genome. The default is to use the background of the object. If specied a valid color then all the background of sequences will be uniform

sequenceGAPColor.C: Color for the deletions, insertions and gaps in the genome browser

sequenceAColor.C: Color for the adenines and alanines in the genome browser

sequenceBColor.C: Color for the degenerate C/G/T and asparagines in the genome browser

sequenceCColor.C: Color for the cytosines and cysteins in the genome browser

sequenceDColor.C: Color for the degenerate A/G/T and aspartic acids in the genome browser

sequenceEColor.C: Color for the glutamic acids in the genome browser

sequenceFColor.C: Color for the phenylalanines in the genome browser

sequenceGColor.C: Color for the guanines and glycines in the genome browser

sequenceHColor.C: Color for the degenerate A/C/T and histidines in the genome browser

sequenceIColor.C: Color for the isoleucines in the genome browser

sequenceKColor.C: Color for the degenerate G/T and lysines in the genome browser

sequenceLColor.C: Color for the leucines in the genome browser

sequenceMColor.C: Color for the degenerate A/G and methionines in the genome browser

sequenceNColor.C: Color for the degenerate A/C/G/T and asparagines in the genome browser

sequencePColor.C: Color for the prolines in the genome browser

sequenceQColor.C: Color for the glutamines in the genome browser

sequenceRColor.C: Color for the degenerate A/G and arginines in the genome browser

sequenceSColor.C: Color for the degenerate G/C and serines in the genome browser

sequenceTColor.C: Color for the thymidines and threonines in the genome browser

sequenceUColor.C: Color for the uracils in the genome browser

sequenceVColor.C: Color for the degenerate A/C/G and valines in the genome browser

sequenceWColor.C: Color for the degenerate A/T and tryptophans in the genome browser

sequenceXColor.C: Color for the any aminoacid code in the genome browser

sequenceYColor.C: Color for the degenerate C/T and tyrosines in the genome browser

sequenceZColor.C: Color for the glutamines in the genome browser

sequenceStartColor.C: Color for the start codon in the genome browser

sequenceEndColor.C: Color for the end codon in the genome browser

debugWithArea.C: Flag to render object areas when debugging

showVersion.C: Flag to show/hide the version when mouse over top-left corner of the canvas

showCode.C: Flag to show/hide the code for the canvas

codeType.C: Output type for the JSON code

disableCode.C: Flag to disable showing the code

disableMenu.C: Flag to disable showing the menu on right clicks

disableToolbar.C: Flag to disable showing the toolbar

disableDataTable.C: Flag to disable showing data table

disableDataFilters.C: Flag to disable showing data filters

disableCustomizer.C: Flag to disable the data explorer

disableTabPanel.C: Flag to disable the tab panels

disableCanvas.C: Flag to disable all canvas events

disableDrag.C: Flag to disable drg events in canvas

disableKeys.C: Flag to disable key binding events. This prevent some default browser shortcuts and it is system specific. Please see the Event section bellow

disablePlusMinusKeys.C: Flag to disable plus / minus key binding events

disableUndoRedoKeys.C: Flag to disable undo / redo key binding events

disableDocument.C: Flag to disable mousemove and mouseup in the document

disableWindow.C: Flag to disable resizing the canvas when the window is resized.

playable.C: Flag to make the plot playable if there are after rendering functions

resizable.C: Flag to disable resizing the canvas by dragging the mouse over the edges

resizableX.C: Flag to disable resizing the width of the canvas by dragging the mouse over the edges

resizableY.C: Flag to disable resizing the height of canvas by dragging the mouse over the edges

movable.C: Flag to disable moving the canvas by dragging the mouse from the move image in the toolbar

maxSubMenus.C: Maximum number of submenus in the context menus

showPrimaryMenus.C: Flag to show/hide the primary menus in toolbar

maxItemMenuCheckbox.C: Maximum number of items in a menu before it becomes a scroll box

infoTimeOut.C: Time in milliseconds to wait between updates for the mouse over info to show up

infoTimeIn.C: Time in milliseconds to start showing info after a mouse over

broadcast.C: Flag to enable broadcasting to other canvasXpress objects in the page

broadcastGroup.C: Group Id for canvas to broadcast to. If not specified then it broadcasts to all canvases

showMousePositionOnDrag.C: Flag to show/hide the mouse position when dragging in relation to the zero coordinate (top-right) of the canvas

toolbarSize.C: Height for the toolbar in graphs

toolbarItems.C: Array containing the items in the toolbar. All items included by default

lazyLoad.C: Load canvas only if shown in viewport

hoverTemplate.C: HTML string to use as template for the hover info

showAnimation.C: Flag to show/hide the animation for the graphs

showTransition.C: Flag to show/hide the transitions for the graphs

stripBackgroundColor.C: Color for the layout label strip background

stripBackgroundBorderColor.C: Color for the border in layout label strip background

stripBackgroundBorderSize.C: Size for the border line in layout label strip background

stripBackgroundBorderLineType.C: Type of line for the border in layout label strip background

stripTextFontStyle.C: Font style for the label strip text in layout graphs

stripTextColor.C: Color for the text in label strip text in layout graphs

stripTextFontSize.C: Font size for the text in label strip text in layout graphs. Be aware that auto scaling font must be turned off for this property to take effect. A more convenient way to modify the size is to use the stripTextScaleFontFactor

stripTextScaleFontFactor.C: Scaling factor used to increase or decrease the label strip text in layout graphs font size in the canvas

stripTextAlign.C: Align for the label strip text in layout graphs

stripTextBaseline.C: Baseline for the label strip text in layout graphs

stripTextRotate.C: Rotation in degrees for the label strip text in layout graphs

stripTextMargin.C: Margin used in label strip text in layout graphs

stripShow.C: Flag to show/hide the the layout label strip

stripThickness.C: Thickness of the layout label strip

layoutTopology.C: Topology of the canvas. Number of columns and rows separated by X. For example: 2X1, 1X3, etc

layoutAdjust.C: Flag to force recalculating the ranges in the axes when multiple graphs are displayed in the canvas

layoutGlobalGroups.C: Flag to force same groups across all layout plots

layoutCollapse.C: Flag to make layout graphs without any space in between

layoutType.C: Type of layout to place the position for the labels in the trellis plot. Identify the axis that will be used to place the first segregating factor. rows will use the first segregating factor in the rows and the second in the columns. cols will use the first segregating factor in the columns and the second in the rows. wrap will wrap the segregating factors putting the sample factors in the columns

layoutRemoveEmpty.C: Flag to remove empty combinations in segregated layouts

layoutCanvasCompartments.C: Flag to draw lines around each graph in the layout in the canvas. Used only when debugging

layoutLabelFontStyle.C: Font style for the label text in layout graphs

layoutLabelColor.C: Color for the text in label text in layout graphs

layoutLabelFontSize.C: Font size for the text in label text in layout graphs. Be aware that auto scaling font must be turned off for this property to take effect. A more convenient way to modify the size is to use the layoutLabelScaleFontFactor

layoutLabelScaleFontFactor.C: Scaling factor used to increase or decrease the label text in layout graphs font size in the canvas

layoutLabelAlign.C: Align for the label text in layout graphs

layoutLabelBaseline.C: Baseline for the label text in layout graphs

layoutLabelRotate.C: Rotation in degrees for the label text in layout graphs

layoutLabelMargin.C: Margin used in label text in layout graphs

layoutConfig.C: Array of object to assign visualization configurations to each layout

layoutAxis.C: Flag to indicated whether to print axes values when multiple graphs are displayed in the canvas. The possible values are: 1: horizontal, 2: vertical, 3: both

imageTimeOut.C: Time in milliseconds to wait to load images

imageMaxTries.C: Maximum times to try to load images. Used to calculate the timeout which will be imageTimeOut / imageTries which will be 100ms by default

remoteService.C: Url used to obtain data remotely thorugh a web service or directly from a file. If the remote service is a file then it expects a json file with a two dimensional array. Each of the arrays should have a key (which will be used in a drop down menu) and a value to point to a url where to get the data. If the remote service is a web service it expects a canvasXpress object. The default parameters for web services are index (to identify the current record number) and dir (to identify the direction; it could be either next or prev)

remoteParams.C: Object to hold additional parameters used to obtain data remotely. The target property will be always added to the method as well as the direction [next|prev]

remoteDirection.C: Direction parameter used to obtain data remotely

remoteAutoPlay.C: Flag to automatically iterate over remote data sets

remoteAutoPlayDelay.C: Time in milliseconds to wait between iterations while automatically going over remote data sets

remoteParamOverride.C: Flag to override parameters to maintain the state of the graphs when using remote services

remoteAutoSize.C: Flag to adjust remote graph to current canvas size

loadRDatasets.C: Flag to load R datasets from Github

widgetsBackgroundColor.C: Color for the background all the UI widgets. It only applied if the dataUIStyle is set to false

widgetsBaseColor.C: Color for the elements in all the UI widgets. It only applied if the dataUIStyle is set to false

widgetsHoverTransparency.C: Transparency for the elements in all the UI widgets when mouse overs. It only applied if the dataUIStyle is set to false

widgetsAccentColor.C: Color for the accent elements in all the UI widgets. It only applied if the dataUIStyle is set to false

widgetsContrastColor.C: Color for the contrast elements in all the UI widgets. It only applied if the dataUIStyle is set to false

widgetsStripedColor.C: Color for the stripe elements in the data table

widgetsFontSize.C: Font size for the elements in all the UI widgets. It only applied if the dataUIStyle is set to false

widgetsFontColor.C: Color for the the elements in all the UI widgets. It only applied if the dataUIStyle is set to false

widgetsIconClsAColor.C: Color for the class-a widget icons

widgetsIconClsBColor.C: Color for the class-b widget icons

widgetsIconClsCColor.C: Color for the class-c widget icons

maxDataCustomizerEntries.C: Maximum number of samples or variables to display in the data customizer

customizerSize.C: Size for the customizer. Requires re-opening of customizer

customizerEntriesAsList.C: Flag to show entries in scrolling widgets as text. The default is to show them as icons-like

customizerGraphMaximize.C: Flag to maximize the graph when the customizer is called

skipConfigurableProperties.C: Flag to indicate to exclude configurable parameters in the data table and the data filters in Networks and Genome Browser

nodesProperties.C: Two dimensional array with object properties not at the root level for the nodes in the Network graph to include in the Data table and the data filter

edgesProperties.C: Two dimensional array with object properties not at the root level for the edges in the Network graph to include in the Data table and the data filter

featuresProperties.C: Two dimensional array with object properties not at the root level for the features in the Genome graph to include in the Data table and the data filter

dataFilterWidth.C: Size in pixels for the data filters

filterType.C: Type for the filter. Can be and or or

filterMode.C: Mode for the legend filters. Can be set to hide the data using transparency or to color the data points with the missingDataColor

filterSkipNullKeys.C: Flag to indicate to bypass filtering when a key is non existent in the data objects

filterSkipNullValues.C: Flag to indicate to bypass filtering when a value is null

filterVarBy.C: Filter variables by their annotation included in the data.z object used in one dimensional plots. Used in the CanvasXpress UIs

filterSmpBy.C: Filter samples by their annotation included in the data.x object used in one dimensional plots. Used in the CanvasXpress UIs

filterNodeBy.C: Filter nodes by their properties used in network graphs. Used in the CanvasXpress UIs

filterEdgeBy.C: Filter edges by their properties used in network graphs. Used in the CanvasXpress UIs

filterFeatureBy.C: Filter features by their properties used in genome browser. Used in the CanvasXpress UIs

filterDataBy.C: Filter data by their value in the data object used in oncoprints. Used in the CanvasXpress UIs

dataTableTransposed.C: Flag to transpose the data in the data table

maxRows.C: Maximum number of rows to display in the data table

maxCols.C: Maximum number of columns to display in the data table

colWidth.C: Number of pixels for the width of cells in the data table

rowHeight.C: Number of pixels for the height of cells in the data table

rowLines.C: Number of lines in cells in the data table

refresehDataTableOnDraw.C: Flag to indicate to refresh data after drawing the plot

showDataTableOnSelect.C: Flag to show/hide the Flag to indicate to show data after selecting data in the plot

networkShowDataTable.C: Show nodes or edges on data table

colorDataTableTransparency.C: Transparency for the background of the data table cells if colored

dataTableImage.C: Image to brand the data table

dataTableRowProperties.C: Properties for the rows in the data table. Key is the variable name and the value is the height in pixels

dataTableColProperties.C: Properties for the cols in the data table. Key is the sample name and the value is the width in pixels

dataTableColHide.C: Array to store the columns to hide in the data table

dataTableColOrder.C: Array to store the column sorting for the data table. It only applies to meta data and exclude variables or samples. Those not included willl be placed last

dataTableRowOrder.C: Array to store the row sorting for the data table. It only applies to meta data and exclude variables or samples. Those not included willl be placed last

colorDataTable.C: Flag to color the data table

dataTableBorderColor.C: Color for the border of the data table cells

dataTableHeaderBordersShow.C: Flag to show/hide the Flag to show the borders in the data table headers. The color of the border will be the same as that used for the base color of the UI widgets

dataTableStripeShow.C: Flag to show/hide the Flag to show the stripes in the data table rows

dataTableStripeTransparency.C: Transparency for the stripes in the data table using the base color for the UI widgets

dataTableZeroHeader.C: Name for the first column in the data table
